description: A raw pair of frog legs.  Tastes like chicken when cooked or smoked.
An uncooked fish fillet.  Makes a passable meal raw.
A tiny scrap of edible fish.  It's not much, but it'll do in a pinch.
A cooked fish fillet.  Very nutritious.
A chunk of uncooked lobster meat.
A chunk of delicious cooked lobster meat.
The raw flesh of a mollusk.  Must be cleaned and cooked before eating.
//: Nutrition information roughly based on squid. if you know more pls expand

description: Cooked mollusk meat.  Devoid of any parasites or bacteria due to heat, the only thing left to do is add sauce.
A handful of lucky gastropods that have been prepared for cooking by repeatedly boiling and washing them to remove their mucus and pathogens.
//: Nutrition information roughly based on a serving of 6 snails. if you know more pls expand

description: Cooked gastropods.  A bit low on calories, but high in protein.
The stomach of a human.  It is surprisingly durable.
The stomach of a large humanoid creature.  It is surprisingly durable.
A chunk of raw fat, harvested from a human body.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered human fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of dry-rendered human fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A chunk of raw meat, butchered from a human body.
A cooked slice of some unpleasant person.  Tastes great.
A cooked slice of some unpleasant person properly seasoned with black pepper and salt.  Tastes great.
A chunk of raw meat.  You could eat it as-is, but cooking it is better.
Blood extracted from a living creature.
A fatty cut of pork from the belly, popular in some cuisine.  With proper technique, it can be used to create bacon.  Not safe to consume in its current raw form.
Porkbelly that has been preserved and flavored with salt and sugar to draw out the moisture from the first layer.  Still raw, it is ready for smoking into bacon.
A huge slab of uncut smoked bacon.  You can eat it as is, but it would be more efficient to cut it into smaller portions with a knife.
//: High price to reflect the rarity and value of bacon. Note that this is three pieces of it.

description: Porkbelly in the process of becoming fully cured with salt and sugar, capable of becoming bacon.  The flavor is slowly developing at this stage, and is significantly unpleasant due to the residual salt.  Activate it once completed to make use of the final product.

use_action.msg: You pat off a bit of extra brine from the slice; this piece of meat is now fully cured.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The meat isn't fully cured yet.

description: A tiny scrap of raw meat.  It's not much, but it'll do in a pinch.
A tiny scrap of raw human flesh.
A tiny scrap of raw demihuman flesh.
Raw meat from a heavily mutated animal.
Blood extracted from a heavily mutated creature.
A tiny scrap of raw meat from a heavily mutated animal.  It smells unappealing, to say the least.

Raw meat butchered from the body of a heavily mutated creature that was unsettlingly humanoid in appearance.  It has odd bits of fur and other tissue lodged in it that clearly don't belong.  You'd have to be crazy or starving to eat this.
Blood extracted from a heavily mutated human.
Cooked meat from a heavily mutated humanoid.  Now that the worst bits have been picked out, it's probably digestible, if not very appetizing.

Cooked meat from a heavily mutated humanoid.  Now that the worst bits have been picked out, it's probably digestible.  It has also been properly seasoned with black pepper and salt, giving it a better taste.  Still, it is somewhat gross, but hey, it's food!
Rotten mutant meat that has been heavily smoked for preservation.

//: This item should not get any use whatsoever, it is merely conservation of mass and an attractor for carrion.
description: Eugh.  This is a mess of dirt, excreta, connective tissue, and bits of matter like hair and claws, leftover from the butchering process.  Eating it isn't even worth thinking about.
A chunk of cooked meat.  It's filling and nutritious, but unseasoned and a bit bland.
A piece of cooked meat, properly seasoned with black pepper and salt.  It's nutritious, yet basic seasoning adds a welcoming taste to this simple dish.
A chunk of cooked fatty meat.  Although absent of vitamins, it is very filling and delightfully greasy.
A chunk of cooked fatty meat properly seasoned with black pepper and salt.  Although absent of vitamins, it is very filling, tasty and delightfully greasy.
A cooked scrap of meat that has been properly seasoned with pepper and salt.  Yet small, they have a good taste.
A cooked chunk of meat from a mutated animal.
A cooked chunk of meat from a mutated animal which has been properly seasoned with black pepper and salt, will keep your hunger away, but even seasoned, it has a weird taste.
A tiny scrap of cooked mutant meat.  It is small enough that it's hard to tell how disgusting it is.

name.str: cooked pepper scrap of mutant meat
name.str_pl: cooked pepper scraps of mutant meat

description: A tiny scrap of cooked mutant meat properly seasoned with black pepper and salt.  It is small, and even though it has been seasoned, it has a weird taste.
Bone marrow, fully cooked to eliminate any parasites.  Tasty!
Bone marrow, fully cooked to eliminate any parasites and properly seasoned with black pepper and salt.  Tasty!
A selection of uncooked internal organs and entrails.  Filled with essential vitamins, but most people consider it a bit gross unless it's very carefully prepared.
A selection of cooked organs and entrails.  Filled with essential vitamins, but pretty unappetizing in this form.
An unidentifiable selection of rotted innards that barely hold their form.  It is revolting and certainly no longer healthy to eat.
Raw organs from a giant mutant bug.
A selection of cooked mutant bug organs.  Looks awful, but if you give it a try, you'll find -- that it's worse than it looks.
A mass of entrails and organ meat, preserved in brine.  Packed with essential vitamins, and although it looks like a lab specimen, it actually tastes pretty palatable.
Cooked organ meat and entrails, preserved by canning.  Unappetizing, but filled with essential vitamins.
The stomach of a woodland creature.  It is surprisingly durable.
The stomach of a large woodland creature.  It is surprisingly durable.
Salty dried meat that lasts for a long time, but will make you thirsty.
Salty dried fish that lasts for a long time, but will make you thirsty.
Salty dried mollusk that lasts for a long time, but will make you thirsty.
Tasty meat that has been heavily smoked for preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.
Tasty fish that has been heavily smoked for long term preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.
Tasty lobster that has been heavily smoked for long term preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.
Tasty mollusk that has been heavily smoked for long term preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.

A portion of lung from an animal.  It's spongy and pink, and spoils very quickly.  It can be a delicacy if properly prepared - but if improperly prepared, it's a chewy lump of flavorless connective tissue.
A portion of lung from a human.  It's spongy and pink, and spoils very quickly.  It appears to have been extracted too crudely to ever be useful as a transplant.
A portion of lung from a demihuman being.  It's spongy and pink, and spoils very quickly.
A chewy, grayish lump of flavorless connective tissue.  It doesn't look any tastier than it did raw, but any parasites are all cooked out.
A portion of an animal's heart.  It's tough but not that chewy, and it spoils very quickly.
A portion of heart from a human.  It's tough but not that chewy, and it spoils very quickly.  It appears to have been extracted too crudely to ever be useful as a transplant.
A portion of heart from a demihuman being.  It's tough but not that chewy, and it spoils very quickly.
A roasted piece of heart.  It doesn't look any tastier than it did raw, but any parasites are all cooked out.

name.str: piece of raw mutant humanoid heart
name.str_pl: pieces of raw mutant humanoid heart

description: You're pretty sure this is lung tissue.

A piece of liver from an animal.  Although many dislike its texture, it's one of the more vitamin-rich parts of the animal.  It is very good in sausages, but maybe a little less appetizing when cooked on its own.
A piece of liver from a human, which appears to have been extracted too crudely to ever be useful as a transplant.
A chunk of liver from a demihuman being.
Chock-full of A- and B-Vitamins!  Cooked liver isn't all that bad, depending on how you feel about the texture, but this is probably the least fancy way to do it.
A soft, spongy substance found in bones, rich in fat.  Chock-full of good stuff and doesn't taste too bad even raw, but beware of parasites.

name.str: portion of raw human bone marrow
name.str_pl: portions of raw human bone marrow

description: Soft, spongy marrow tissue from a human bone.

name.str: portion of raw demihuman bone marrow
name.str_pl: portions of raw demihuman bone marrow

description: Soft, spongy marrow tissue from a demihuman bone.

name.str: portion of raw mutant bone marrow
name.str_pl: portions of raw mutant bone marrow

description: Soft, spongy and oddly-colored marrow tissue from the bone of a heavily mutated animal.

name.str: portion of raw mutant human bone marrow
name.str_pl: portions of raw mutant human bone marrow

description: Soft, spongy and oddly-colored marrow tissue from the bone of a heavily mutated creature that was unsettlingly humanoid in appearance.
A chunk of brain from an animal.  You wouldn't want to eat this raw…
A chunk of brain from a human.  Eating this may cause kuru, but you probably won't live long enough to care about that anyway.
A chunk of brain from a demihuman being.  Don't prion diseases cross species barriers?
Now you can emulate those zombies you love so much!  Preparing brain for eating is challenging, and this doesn't seem to be the best way to do it.
A chunk of kidney from an animal.  Preparing it for cooking is a challenge unless you want the kitchen to smell strongly of urine.
A chunk of kidney from a human, which appears to have been extracted too crudely to ever be useful as a transplant.
This is probably a piece of kidney extracted from a demihuman being.
No, this is not beans.
A piece of the thymus or pancreas of an animal.  These are a delicacy, if prepared properly.
A piece of the thymus or pancreas of a human, which appears to have been extracted too crudely to ever be useful as a transplant.
The consistency of this chunk of organ suggests possibly a thymus or pancreas equivalent.
Normally a delicacy, but this style of preparation is missing something.
Blood extracted from a human being.
A chunk of raw fat.  You could eat it as-is, but it is better used as an ingredient in other foods or projects.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered animal fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of dry-rendered animal fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A chunk of raw fat butchered from a heavily-mutated animal.  It smells, if anything, even more disgusting than the rest of the mutant.  There are little puddles of unidentified oils dripping from it.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered fat, sourced from a mutant animal.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of dry-rendered fat, sourced from a mutant animal.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
Raw fat butchered from a heavily-mutated humanoid.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered fat, sourced from a mutant humanoid.  It won't rot for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of dry-rendered fat, sourced from a mutant humanoid.  It won't rot for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A piece of meat that's obviously unhealthy.  You could eat it, but it will poison you.
A rotted and then shredded arm.  Not much use unless you want to scrape the meat from the bones.
What's left of some zombie's limb.  Most likely a leg based on the proportions.  Though it's rotted, there is quite a bit of meat still on it.
Blood that's obviously unhealthy.  You could drink it, but it will poison you.
A wet, green chunk of spongy goop extracted from a rotten bone.  You could eat it, but it will poison you.
A watery yellow glob of fat from some unnatural creature or other.  You could eat it, but it will poison you.
//: Not for use in edible recipes, and should require ~200% as much as normal for applicable inedible recipes.

description: A smooth grayish block of cleaned and rendered monster fat.  It will remain 'fresh' for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many projects.  You could eat it, but it will poison you.
//: Not for use in edible/foodsafe recipes.  Inefficiency is handled by tainted tallow recipe requiring 200% as much materials input as regular tallow recipe.

description: A boiled stomach from an animal, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
A boiled stomach from a large humanoid creature, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
A small boiled stomach from an animal, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
A small boiled stomach from a human, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
A carefully folded raw skin harvested from an animal.  You can cure it for storage and tanning, or eat it if you're desperate enough.

A carefully folded raw skin harvested from an unnatural creature.  The smell of rot is overwhelming, and it has an ghastly unnatural feeling with a wide variety of cuts, divots, and malformed lumps covering the sickly green-gray skin.  This can't be used for anything useful.
Shredded scraps of raw skin from an unnatural creature.  It can't have much use.

A carefully folded raw skin harvested from a human.  Despite some dubious historical accounts, the usefulness of human skin is limited, and can't be made into leather.  The skin is still edible, if you're that desperate.

A carefully folded raw skin harvested from a demihuman.  Despite being from a human-enough body, the leather has this distinct unnatural and alien feeling to it, and would be a very poor substitute for leather.  The skin is still edible, if you're that desperate.
A carefully folded raw skin harvested from a fur-bearing animal.  It still has the fur attached.  You can cure it for storage and tanning, or eat it if you're desperate enough.

A carefully folded raw pelt harvested from an unnatural creature.  The smell of rot is overwhelming, with bits of flesh cling to the mangy, sickly patches of fur still present on the pelt.  This can't be used for anything useful.
A carefully folded raw skin harvested from a fur-bearing mutant human.  It still has the fur attached.  You can cure it for storage and tanning, or eat it if you're desperate enough.
A thick mass of flesh superficially resembling a mammalian heart.  It's the size of your fist and covered in dimpled grooves.

A thick, hulking mass of flesh that's easily the size of your head, superficially resembling a mammalian heart and covered in ribbed grooves.  It's still full of whatever passes for blood in jabberwocks, and is heavy in your hands.  After everything you've seen lately, you can't help but remember old sayings about eating the hearts of your enemies…
A huge strip of muscle - all that remains of a putrid heart that has been sliced open and drained of blood.  It could be eaten if you're hungry, but looks *disgusting*.
A tubular leathery organ of an alien creature, comprised of tough muscle tissue.  Dozens of deep ridges make up the slimy surface, like a disgusting rendition of an accordion.

A segmented chitinous shell with curious markings is sheltering a weird alien larva, squirming and wiggling around.  Theorizing what it could eventually turn into, you're unsure if it is safe to keep around.

The fleshy fronds harvested from an alien plant.  Eating these membranous leaves and gut-like stems is likely a terrible idea, and yet they have a paradoxically pleasant and inviting sweet smell.  Might be non-vegan.

The alien beauty of this indigo flower is betrayed by its disgustingly fleshy composition.  What from afar appear to be petals are but layered membranes of transparent veiny flesh, given color by a covering of blue iridescent ichor.  Even if it is certainly poisonous, it has a pleasant medicinal smell to it.

use_action.activation_message: Even a close smell of this alien flower feels deeply intoxicating.

description: Dry and tough bark matter harvested from an alien plant.  It is slightly translucent, and if placed against the light you can distinguish glistening blue veins running through it.
The stomach of an intelligent demihuman.  It is surprisingly durable.
The stomach of a large humanoid creature.  It is surprisingly durable.
Raw fat harvested from a demihuman body.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered demihuman fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of dry-rendered demihuman fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
Raw meat butchered from a demihuman body.
Blood extracted from a demihuman.
A cooked slice of something close to being a real person.  Tastes like long pig.
A boiled stomach from a demihuman, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
A small boiled stomach from a demihuman, nothing else.  It looks all but appetizing.
Delicious oil-fried meat.

//: It's so alien few micro organisms are able to degrade it.
description: A piece of mi-go meat that's obviously alien, given its pink color, odd odor, and strange texture.  It would not be advisable to try to eat it.
Goo from inside a mi-go, perhaps some kind of blood?  It's obviously alien, given its pink color and strange, nostril-stinging odor.  It would not be advisable to try to eat it.

An unrecognized structural element from inside a mi-go.  It's strong and springy, somewhat like cartilage, but a bit stiffer.  It's also a deep green color, and might possibly serve a scaffolding role, like bone.
A chunk of raw meat from a bird.  Dangerous to eat as-is.
//: Scaled from 100g skin on, boneless, wild duck meat from USDA database

description: A tiny scrap of raw meat from a bird.  You figure that one of these should be about one fifth of a portion.  Dangerous to eat as-is.
A chunk of bird meat that has been cooked.  Nutritious and safe to eat, but a bit bland.
A cut of bird meat that has been cooked with salt and pepper.  The simple addition of spices has made it much more palatable.
A tiny scrap of cooked meat from a bird.  Not very filling, and a bit bland.
A tiny scrap of cooked bird meat, seasoned with simple spices.  Makes for a nice high-protein snack.
Strip of bird meat that has been heavily smoked for preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.
A chunk of raw meat with a weirdly off-green coloration.  You could eat it as-is, but are you sure you want to?
